title: Dual-readout calorimetry with homogeneous crystals
authors:
R. Hirosky, T. Anderson, G. Cummings, M. Dubnowski, C. Guinto-Brody,
  Y. Guo, A. Ledovskoy, D. Levin, C. Madrid, C. Martin, and J. Zhu
abstract:
High resolution calorimetry with state-of-the-art energy resolution
performance for both electromagnetic (EM) and hadronic signals can be achieved
using the dual-readout (DR) technique, both in a homogeneous
scintillating-crystal calorimeter and in a traditional fiber and absorber-based
DR hadronic section. We present results from the CalVision consortium studying
the collection of Cerenkov and scintillation signals in PbWO$_4$ and BGO
crystal samples exposed to 120\,GeV proton beams at the Fermilab Test Beam
Facility, including proof-of-principle measurements aimed at demonstrating the
identification of a sufficiently large Cerenkov signal in homogeneous
scintillating crystals to support dual-readout capability.
